# ggsegKleist <img src='man/figures/logo.png' align="right" height="138.5" />

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegKleist/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/ggsegverse/ggsegKleist/actions)
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/425006974.svg)](https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/425006974)
<!-- badges: end -->

This package contains the Kleist 1934 historical atlas of functional segregation for plotting with ggseg and ggseg3d, based on the supplementary materials of Pijnenburg et al., NeuroImage, 239, 2021 [DOI](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2021.118274); Version 1; 15-01-2021.

Kleist K. (1934) Gehirnpathologie vornehmlich auf Grund der Kriegserfahrungen (Leipzig: Barth).

To learn how to use these atlases, please look at the documentation for [ggseg](https://ggsegverse.github.io/ggseg/) and [ggseg3d](https://ggsegverse.github.io/ggseg3d).

## Installation

You can install ggsegKleist from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("ggsegverse/ggsegKleist")
```

## 2D plotting

```{r, fig.height=7}
library(ggsegKleist)
library(ggseg)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot() +
  geom_brain(
    atlas = kleist,
    mapping = aes(fill = label),
    position = position_brain(hemi ~ view),
    show.legend = FALSE
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = kleist$palette, na.value = "grey") +
  theme_void()
```

## 3D plotting

```{r "noneval", eval=FALSE}
library(ggseg3d)

ggseg3d(atlas = kleist) |>
  add_glassbrain() |>
  pan_camera("right lateral")
```

```{r "orca", include=FALSE}
p <- ggseg3d::ggseg3d(atlas = kleist) |>
  ggseg3d::add_glassbrain(hemisphere = "left") |>
  ggseg3d::pan_camera("right lateral") |>
  plotly::add_annotations(text = "Screen capture",
                          legendtitle = TRUE, showarrow = FALSE,
                          font = list(color = "#000000b4",
                                      family = "sans serif",
                                      size = 50))
plotly::orca(p, "man/figures/README-3d-plot.png")
```

```{r "incl", echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/README-3d-plot.png")
```
